definition: to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: The name of the eclipsing girl, whatever it was, has not been handed down.
sentences.chinese: 压倒群芳的少女，姓名并未留传下来。

sentences.english: This holy image of the Dragon King came down to me from Guru Chen.
sentences.chinese: 此龙王圣像乃陈上师留传下来给我的。

sentences.english: They say he wrote poems the world will always know.
sentences.chinese: 专家们还说他写过的诗，这个世界将永久留传。

sentences.english: May his name endure forever; may it continue as long as the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他的名要存到永远，要留传如日之久。

sentences.english: This ring has been in my family for generations.
sentences.chinese: 这只戒指已在我家留传好几代了。

definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
to pass on/to hand down/tradition has it that .../according to legend
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
from generation to generation/generation after generation
legend/folklore/to repeat from mouth to mouth/they say that...
